results.definition: an artifact that has been created by someone or some process
examples: they export most of their agricultural production

results.definition: the quantity of something (as a commodity) that is created (usually within a given period of time)
examples: production was up in the second quarter

results.definition: a display that is exaggerated or unduly complicated
examples: she tends to make a big production out of nothing

results.definition: a presentation for the stage or screen or radio or television
examples: have you seen the new production of Hamlet?

results.definition: (economics) manufacturing or mining or growing something (usually in large quantities) for sale
examples: he introduced more efficient methods of production

results.definition: (law) the act of exhibiting in a court of law
examples: the appellate court demanded the production of all documents

results.definition: the act or process of producing something
examples: Shakespeare's production of poetry was enormous
the production of white blood cells

results.definition: the creation of value or wealth by producing goods and services
